item.title: Microsoft and Yahoo agree search deal
item.description: Microsoft and Yahoo have agreed an online alliance that could create a more formidable rival to Google in the internet search business

item.title: Wall Street lower on earnings concerns
item.description: Wall Street opened weaker amid concerns about bearish US economic indicators and some jitters on the back of a fall in Chinese stock markets

item.title: US durable goods orders fall in June
item.description: New orders for durable goods declined in June, as demand for transportation equipment and aircraft plunged, the commerce department said

item.title: Time Warner second-quarter profit falls
item.description: Time Warner’s second quarter net profit fell due to double-digit percentage declines in print and online advertising, but edged well ahead of expectations

item.title: China shares tumble on liquidity fears
item.description: Chinese stocks suffered their worst one-day fall for eight months amid fears that the country’s central bank might take steps to curb liquidity

item.title: Sprint loss widens as customers defect
item.description: Sprint Nextel’s net loss widened by 12 per cent year over year to $384m in the second quarter, as the wireless carriers increase in prepaid revenues failed to offset the decline in its contract wireless service

item.title: Temasek may seek outside capital
item.description: Temasek, the Singapore state investment company, is considering expanding its stakeholder base and for the first time seeking outside capital from institutions and the public for joint investment projects

item.title: US and China display united economic stance
item.description: The US and China sought to present a common front on economic co-operation but remained at odds over climate change at the end of two days of top-level consultations that highlighted Beijing’s growing confidence and assertiveness.

item.title: Apple rejects Google applications for iPhone
item.description: Apple has banned iPhone applications based on Google Voice in a new sign of growing rivalry between the powerful Silicon Valley allies Apple and Google, which have drawn recent regulatory attention for their close ties, have found another area where they will have to agree to disagree.

item.title: US home price rise hints at stability
item.description: US house prices showed their first monthly gain in three years in May offering another sign that the stricken residential real estate market is stabilising
